title: [BUG] MLFlow Pipelines Open fails on Linux

labels.name: area/recipes
labels.description: MLflow Recipes, Recipes APIs, Recipes configs, Recipe Templates

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### MLflow version

mlflow, version 1.27.0

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:
Red Hat Enterprise Linux release 8.6 (Ootpa)

- **Python version**:
4.8

- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**:


### Describe the problem

When running a pipeline on linux the pipeline fails when attempting to open the html file with the following error:

```
Couldn't get a file descriptor referring to the console
```

It appears the step command attempts to utilize the `open` command in the following file:

mlflow/pipelines/utils/step.py", line 81, in display_html

```python
subprocess.run(["open", html_file_path], check=True)
```

`open` is the correct command on MacOS to open a file from the command line but in Linux it should use `xdg-open`.  `open` is still a valid command in Linux but it serves a different purpose from `open` on MacOS and `xdg-open`.

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

```sh
git clone https://github.com/mlflow/mlp-regression-template.git
cd mlp-regression-template
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
mlflow pipelines run --step split
```

### Other info / logs

```python-traceback
2022/07/25 15:25:48 INFO mlflow.pipelines.utils.step: Opening HTML file at: '/home/user/.mlflow/pipelines/5aec531bf0b8a3fdce03a58ff123085ef27fd6bdc47f9450eaf9b87078c8d0ff/steps/split/outputs/card.html'
Couldn't get a file descriptor referring to the console
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/bin/mlflow", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1130, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1055, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1657, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1657, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1404, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 760, in invoke
    return __callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/cli.py", line 46, in run
    Pipeline(profile=profile).run(step)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/regression/v1/pipeline.py", line 337, in run
    return super().run(step=step)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/pipeline.py", line 82, in run
    self.inspect(last_executed_step.name)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/regression/v1/pipeline.py", line 588, in inspect
    super().inspect(step=step)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/pipeline.py", line 118, in inspect
    self._get_step(step).inspect(output_directory)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/step.py", line 150, in inspect
    display_html(html_data=card.to_html(), html_file_path=card_html_path)
  File "/home/user/code/mlp-regression-template/venv/lib64/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/utils/step.py", line 81, in display_html
    subprocess.run(["open", html_file_path], check=True)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.8/subprocess.py", line 516, in run
    raise CalledProcessError(retcode, process.args,
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['open', '/home/user/.mlflow/pipelines/5aec531bf0b8a3fdce03a58ff123085ef27fd6bdc47f9450eaf9b87078c8d0ff/steps/split/outputs/card.html']' returned non-zero exit status 1.
```
